content.question: A student is holding one end of a spring. The other end of the spring is attached to a metal ring, as shown, that can slide freely along a vertical rod. The student creates one wave on the spring, and the ring moves up and down the rod. The student creates a second wave, and the ring does not move. Which of the following can be concluded about the two waves and their polarizations?

choices.label: The first wave is transverse and polarized vertically. The second wave is transverse and polarized vertically.
The first wave is transverse and polarized vertically. The second wave is longitudinal.
The first wave is transverse and is not polarized horizontally. The second wave is transverse and polarized horizontally.
The first wave is transverse and is not polarized horizontally. The second wave could be either longitudinal or transverse and polarized horizontally.

content.answer: The first wave is transverse and is not polarized horizontally. The second wave could be either longitudinal or transverse and polarized horizontally.
